greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of Sum_{k>=1} lambda(k) * k * x^k/(1 + x^k) where lambda(k) is the Liouville function, A008836.
comment: Related to the logarithmic derivative of A118207(x) and A118208(x).
Related to a signed variant of A022998 via Mobius inversion. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 03 2011
formula: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} (-1)^(n/d - 1)*lambda(d)*d, Dirichlet convolution of A061019 and A062157.
G.f.: A(x) is x times the logarithmic derivative of A118207(x).
Dirichlet g.f.: zeta(s)*zeta(2s-2)*(1-2^(1-s))/zeta(s-1). - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 03 2011
a(n) > 0 for n in A028260. - _Michel Marcus_, Dec 10 2016
mathematica: nmax = 80; lambda[k_Integer?Positive] := If[ k > 1, (-1)^Total[ Part[Transpose[FactorInteger[k]], 2] ], 1 ]; Drop[ CoefficientList[ Series[ Sum[ lambda[k] k x^k/(1 + x^k), {k, 1, nmax} ], {x, 0, nmax} ], x ], 1 ]
results.author: _Stuart Clary_, Apr 15 2006
